sections.name: BIOLOGY
sections.description: Choose the correct option for each question. Each question carries 1 mark.

questions.question: What is the process by which green plants use sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide to create their own food?
Which part of a plant is primarily responsible for absorbing water and nutrients from the soil?
What gas do humans and animals breathe out during respiration?
What is a key difference between unicellular and multicellular organisms?
choices: Unicellular organisms have complex organ systems
Unicellular organisms perform all life processes within a single cell
questions.answer: Unicellular organisms perform all life processes within a single cell

questions.question: What is the primary role of the nucleus within a cell?
Why is staining often used when observing cells, like onion peel cells, under a microscope?
choices: To make the cell parts colourless
To make transparent cell parts like the nucleus more visible
To increase the size of the cell
To keep the cell alive longer
questions.answer: To make transparent cell parts like the nucleus more visible

questions.question: Which organ system in the human body is responsible for pumping blood?
What is the name of the green pigment found in plant leaves that captures sunlight?
Which of the following is NOT considered a living thing?
Why is regularly washing your hands with soap and water important for staying healthy?
choices: It makes hands look clean only
It removes harmful germs and prevents illness
It is only needed before eating
questions.answer: It removes harmful germs and prevents illness

questions.question: What is the basic structural and functional unit of all known living organisms?
What does the term 'endemic species' mean?
choices: Species found all over the world
Species found naturally only in a specific geographical area
Species that migrate long distances every year
questions.answer: Species found naturally only in a specific geographical area

questions.question: In an ecosystem with snakes that eat mice, what is likely to happen to the mouse population if many snakes are removed?
choices: The number of mice will increase
The number of mice will decrease
The number of mice will remain the same
The mice will leave the ecosystem
questions.answer: The number of mice will increase

questions.question: Children often resemble their parents. Which of these is an example of an inherited physical trait?

sections.name: PHYSICS
sections.description: Choose the correct option for each question. Each question carries 1 mark.

questions.question: What force pulls objects towards the center of the Earth, making them fall when dropped?
What is a major risk associated with synthetic fabrics like nylon or polyester when exposed to high heat or flames?
choices: They melt and can stick to the skin
questions.answer: They melt and can stick to the skin

questions.question: Why is it generally advised not to wear synthetic clothes, like nylon, while working near a fire (e.g., in the kitchen)?
choices: They are too warm to wear
They can melt and stick to the body if they catch fire
questions.answer: They can melt and stick to the body if they catch fire

questions.question: What does the number inside the triangular recycling symbol found on many plastic items indicate?
choices: The number of times it has been recycled
The type of plastic resin used
questions.answer: The type of plastic resin used

questions.question: A plastic bottle has a recycling symbol with the number '1' inside. What type of plastic is it likely made of?
Which of these describes a common physical property of metals?
choices: They are poor conductors of heat

questions.question: The property of metals that allows them to be drawn into thin wires, like copper wires, is called:
When non-metals like sulfur or carbon burn and react with oxygen, what type of oxides do they generally form?
When metals like magnesium or iron react with oxygen, what type of oxides do they generally form?
If you place an iron nail in a solution of copper sulphate, the blue solution turns green and copper deposits on the nail. What does this indicate about the reactivity of iron and copper?
choices: Iron is less reactive than copper
Iron is more reactive than copper
Iron and copper have equal reactivity
Neither iron nor copper is reactive
questions.answer: Iron is more reactive than copper

questions.question: How well does pure, distilled water conduct electricity?
choices: It is a very good conductor
It is a poor conductor (acts as an insulator)
It conducts electricity only when frozen
questions.answer: It is a poor conductor (acts as an insulator)

questions.question: Which process uses electricity to coat a thin layer of one metal onto another metal, often used for decoration or preventing rust (like chrome plating)?
Why is it dangerous to use water to put out a fire involving electrical appliances that are plugged in?
choices: Water makes the fire burn hotter
Water can damage the appliance further
Water conducts electricity and can cause electric shock
Water turns into steam too quickly
questions.answer: Water conducts electricity and can cause electric shock

questions.question: What gas from the air is essential for burning (combustion) to happen?

sections.name: ENGLISH
sections.description: Choose the correct option for each question. Each question carries 1 mark.

questions.question: Which of the following words is a noun?
What is the opposite of the word 'start'?
Identify the verb in the following sentence: 'The birds sing sweetly in the morning.'
Which sentence is grammatically correct?
What punctuation mark is usually used at the end of a sentence that asks a question?
Choose the correct spelling for the word that means to get something.
The word 'bat' can mean a flying mammal or a piece of sports equipment. What is the term for words spelled the same but having different meanings?
The words 'there', 'their', and 'they're' sound the same but have different spellings and meanings. What are these types of words called?
What do we call a word used to describe a noun or pronoun, such as 'blue' in 'blue sky'?
What is the plural form of the noun 'mouse'?
Which word means 'very small'?
What is the past tense of the verb 'eat'?
Which of the following words is a pronoun (a word that replaces a noun)?
What do we call the central topic or message conveyed in a piece of writing, like a story or poem?

sections.name: SOCIAL STUDIES
sections.description: Choose the correct option for each question. Each question carries 1 mark.

questions.question: What is the capital city of India?
Which major ocean lies to the south of India?
What is the system of government called where citizens elect representatives to make laws and decisions for them?
Who was the first Prime Minister of independent India?
Which major mountain range forms India's northern border?
What is a globe?
choices: A flat map of a country
A drawing of the solar system
A spherical model of the Earth
questions.answer: A spherical model of the Earth

questions.question: In India, government functions are divided between the Central government, State governments, and which other level?
Which important document lays down the framework, fundamental rights, principles, and duties for governing India?
On a map, what is the purpose of the 'legend' or 'key'?
choices: To explain the meaning of symbols and colours used on the map
questions.answer: To explain the meaning of symbols and colours used on the map

questions.question: What does secularism mean in the Indian context?
choices: Making one religion the official state religion
The state treating all religions equally and not favouring any one religion
Forcing everyone to follow the same religion
questions.answer: The state treating all religions equally and not favouring any one religion

questions.question: What was a major challenge during the first general elections held in India soon after independence?
choices: Very few people wanted to vote
Organizing elections for a vast population, many of whom were illiterate, across a newly partitioned country
questions.answer: Organizing elections for a vast population, many of whom were illiterate, across a newly partitioned country

questions.question: In India, the central government needs the approval of which body to pass its annual budget (plan for income and spending)?
choices: The Parliament (Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha)
questions.answer: The Parliament (Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha)

questions.question: The Forest Rights Act, 2006, grants certain rights to forest-dwelling tribal communities and other traditional forest dwellers. Which of these is a key right recognized under this Act?
choices: Right to sell forest land to private companies
Right to build large industries inside forests
Rights over community forest resources which they traditionally protected and conserved
Right to prevent anyone from entering the forest
questions.answer: Rights over community forest resources which they traditionally protected and conserved
